website_summaries.verdict: This simple tool is low on features, yet it's high on quality. Worth considering for all it has to offer.
pros: Impact mechanism has a protective aluminum casing
cons: Fewer features than its competitors (no LED, no belt loop)

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Second strongest impact in the shop. Milwaukee is the first. But it is very strong only issue that I'm having is after six months of Hardcore abuse on it it doesn't seem to slow down after let off trigger. almost acts like an air gun. Continues to spin for a bit after let off the trigger. Greasing it helped a little but did not fix my issue. Still works fine still has the power will continue to use it till it goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Castillo

customer_reviews.title: STUBBORN CRANKSHAFT BOLT! NO PROBLEM!
customer_reviews.text: STUBBORN crankshaft bolt twisted right off with no effort! Seriously, I held the trigger down for maybe a full second and it came right off. I have spent weeks trying to remove this bolt using the traditonal methods (heat, penetrating oil, etc). Next, a 46mm castle nut torqued over 300lb. First, I tried by hand with a breaker bar with a 3ft pipe over the handle. I stood on it and bounced but could not get it to loosen. Then I tried the Ingersoll Rand impact. Problem solved! It handled the huge nut with ease. Dont forget to get the red cover sleeve to protect your investment!
customer_reviews.author: JACK Dismas

customer_reviews.title: Love it. But 1/2 shaft that you put socket ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. But 1/2 shaft that you put socket on broke down after 3 month of intermediate use. Will have to buy bare tool since i can't stop the project and will end up with one extra tool after warranty repair. I mean i hope it is covered by the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Maksim Smouzh

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh this thing is awesome. Zipped head bolts off a ford modular motor and lug nuts nooooooo problem. One of the best garage purchases I have made for my small home setup. I bought the protective cases... got them on and used a heat gun lightly to tighten them up. Love the setup so far!
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: You will no longer need air tools. If you ...
customer_reviews.text: You will no longer need air tools. If you off road then you must own one of these. Batteries last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is a BEAST!
customer_reviews.text: I finally moved over from my pneumatic impact tool to electric. The reviews said that this one was the best. I agree! It made rotating my tires so easy that it was almost fun! I did all 4 and the battery still indicates fully charged. It is a little heavier than my pneumatic unit, but there is no hose to mess with. I now keep it in my truck just in case I need it on the road. I highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Bowman

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy Ingersoll Rand impacts as I have a 3/4 as ...
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy Ingersoll Rand impacts as I have a 3/4 as well. This one knocks everything out of the part. On my used truck when I had a shop change out my tires they over-tightened the lug nuts and my 3/4 wasn't able to break them loose. This one did it on the first press. Super easy and an excellent purchased. Followed up with taking out super rusted brake rotors and calipers. Made the job extremely easy compared to my 3/4 that had to struggle to keep up.
customer_reviews.author: Bradbeer

customer_reviews.title: Best in the market for years
customer_reviews.text: I deliver new semis and this is a must have if you need a powerful battery powered impact. This has been the best on the market for years. What other impacts cannot do, it does. When other batteries die, it gets another job done. I got the 5ah batteries and they're worth upgrading to as well. Buy it and thank me when you're done using it.
customer_reviews.author: walter phillip willis

customer_reviews.title: This driver is amazing! Bought it to remove/replace wheel nuts on our ...
customer_reviews.text: This driver is amazing! Bought it to remove/replace wheel nuts on our RV, which are torqued at 470 ft-lbs, and it just removes them as if they were not there. Replacing them with a torque stick at 470 ft-lbs, but the driver isn't even breathing hard. A great improvement over 3/4" breaker bar and cheater pipe!
customer_reviews.author: Parkerman

customer_reviews.title: Snap on 18 volt lithium vs ir 20 volt
customer_reviews.text: I'm a locomotive mechanic, really needed a long lasting cordless for every day heavy duty use. I've Had it for about 5 months now. Really strong. I also have a 18 volt lithium snap on impact and this thing knocks it out of the park in long lasting and torque power and especially for half the price of the snap on. Very satisfied. All the guys in my shop are trying to sell their impacts back to snap on guy.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: super powerful, ,better than snap on...guaranteed
customer_reviews.text: Holy s***..this is the most powerful cordless impact gun that I've owned .yes this is better than my overprice snap on gun guaranteed. .i am a mechanic so far no complaints what so ever!! Price is also great,well made carrying case..i won't ever buy anything but Ingersoll rand when comes to air or battery power impact tools.
customer_reviews.author: chichilover

customer_reviews.title: Very strong electric impact. Had one with the 3ah ...
customer_reviews.text: Very strong electric impact. Had one with the 3ah batteries before, and it lasted about 3 years in the shop before the trigger went out. Ordered this so I could bring the other one to use at home. has as much power as snap-on for less money. Parts, however, are more difficult to find.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Payton

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional mechanic so I may be giving higher marks than this deserves - but it is totally impressive. This tool will do things I didn't think possible with air or electricity, much less a battery. Make sure you have good sockets that fit the bolt/nut very well, because this thing is not going to stop until something gives up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hang on to your pants!
customer_reviews.text: More torque than the $600+ snap-on. Used a brand new Snap-on that worked great, then i tried this out of the box and holy shizzle it busted that nut... I mean pulley bolt, right of that crankshaft with no effort. Good bye air compressor, hello time saving, nut busting, money making, impacting super gun. I only regret not getting the set with 2 batteries, not that I need it yet but just because it's cheaper than getting the additional battery by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Mechanic Mike

customer_reviews.title: Ingersol Rand Battery Impact Tool
customer_reviews.text: Good product. So far the battery is still going with one charge. It is a heavy tool, but it is a beast. High for comparable tools, but I watched the reviews and decided this is the one. If you can afford it, get it. Recommend the seller too.
customer_reviews.author: mlsigner

customer_reviews.title: and still working good. Never recharged the battery yet since I bought ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 Months ago, and still working good. Never recharged the battery yet since I bought it. We use a lot of power tools left and right and my shop air compressor trying to catch up, same as my electricity bill. I started using Snap-On battery power tools to lower my electric bill, but not my wallet and their price is 2x expensive than Ingersoll Rand. I'm surprised how strong this battery powered Impact wrench compared to branded Snap-On, this is way better than any brand. This is made in China as well as Snap-On brand. I recommend this brand as commercial brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mangale

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for replacing air tools
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool -Avoid spinning without a load -Buying the rubber shield is worth it if you drop the tool on concrete floors -It's a pretty big tool so don't expect it to fit in tight areas
customer_reviews.author: john anthony

customer_reviews.title: One of the best impacts I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to work on my Jeep and it did everything I needed to do. This impact just rips all the rusty bolts out like it’s nothing...makes my job so much easier now. Can’t wait to take it to a junk yard and be able to actually take parts off without braking my tools. I give this thing 9.7/10 My only gripe is the weight. Could get a little heavy for one hand use after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.  Snazzy

customer_reviews.title: Good item, will round the best of impact sockets ...
customer_reviews.text: Good item, will round the best of impact sockets if not the correct size or not on 100%, ooops. So I'd say it's a Beast of an impact, will do what you need in the 1/2 in arena, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Paula M

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Tool burnt up3 weeks after warranty was up .i boght 2 of the 3/8 and 2 of the 1/2 inch the ratchet and light plus boot protector for the impact guns.i had no help from the seler or amazon .1 of 3/8 and one of the1/2 inch tools had to go in the trash are in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: steve bane

customer_reviews.title: So Friggen Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4x4 lifted 3/4 ton crew cab with big tires with 8 lugs, makes tire changing something to look forward too...love this thing , so powerful. I consider this a Top of the line tool.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is very powerful so be careful not to use to tighten lug nuts unless you have a torque stick or you will never get them off on the road if you get a flat.
customer_reviews.author: Dave D

customer_reviews.title: best impacts in the industry
customer_reviews.text: This Impact wrench is a beast, had it for years, it still packs a punch even though it's old. batteries still hold a charge. only drawback is the auto stop when you depress the trigger always fails on this model.
customer_reviews.author: ORANGEshinobi

customer_reviews.title: Quality Drill
customer_reviews.text: I love this drill! I have had 2 previous drills of this caliber from Snap-On Tools. While those drills did the job, this one takes the cake. Very high torque with great impacting capability. Any person who wishes to utilize this as weekend warrior to save yourself some money, you can't go wrong here. On my first project alone, the purchase of this drill actually saved me money versus having a mechanic do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Dresser

customer_reviews.title: Wow. It will really bust your nuts.
customer_reviews.text: + Can pop an axle nut like nothing (I had a breaker bar + extension rod and stood on the bar with no luck. This thing popped off the nut like it wasn't even there) + Extremely well built and solid + You can still use it for small stuff. I still purchased a small impact driver though. This thing is a bit weighty for small stuff. - Heavier than expected - It's sooooo cool to use this that you can't find enough uses for it. You sort of have to do a lot of car work to justify it.
customer_reviews.author: FD3S

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Power!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical for many years about cordless impacts, as a Master Tech I am constantly beating up my tools and using them for everything they got and well this thing is amazing, i have yet to find a bolt it will not remove, heck this thing out powers my Snap-On MG725 air gun! The future is here guys, no more needs for huge compressors at home either just take this home with you! If you are looking at this impact and are skeptical just buy it - you WONT regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle R McCombs

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Freaking "sorry for the bad word" love this impact. For a half inch impact gun this one is amazing. I can pretty much take anything off. I work in the automotive industry and I love that I don't need an air hose to use this bad boy. Battery life is pretty good it last all week sometimes more.
customer_reviews.author: haku

customer_reviews.title: Just do it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I liked how it handled the big jobs. I did not like the fact that it took five hours in direct sunlight with it being 100 degrees outside.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Andrew Post

customer_reviews.title: Powerhouse! Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This impact wrench is pretty stout. It will out perform my coworkers impact wrenches(air powered). I tested this thing on an old cv axle to see what kind of power it had. Although it didn't strip out the treads on the axle, it did pull the threads forward( almost stripped it out). That was with a big 36mm deep axle nut socket on the wrench as well. All-in-all i am highly impressed with this unit. On a fully charged battery it lasted all day with half a charge remaining at the end of the day. Didn't even have to touch the other battery. Shipping was great. Got my tool 2 days after i ordered it with standard 5-8 day shipping.
customer_reviews.author: kenny

customer_reviews.title: I was "standing and jumping" on a lug wrench trying ...
customer_reviews.text: I was "standing and jumping" on a lug wrench trying to break an over tightened nut loose on my truck wheel when a guy shows up with one of these tools and simply "pops" the nut off. "I gotta' have one of these." A bit pricey but this thing works so well my wife could remove the nuts on a wheel, It is my new lug wrench for the truck. At 77 years old I am not into turning a lug wrench and this tool is a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon McLellan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool
customer_reviews.text: Power of a pneumatic tool in the palm of your hand, yet cordless! A bit bulkier than air gun but no airline intow is a good trade off! Especially out in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis76nyc

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my husband,who is a tow truck driver and uses it for quick tire changes roadside,is very sturdy and worth every cent!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's bad, it's one powerful tool
customer_reviews.text: It's big, it's bad, it's one powerful tool! It'll remove the most difficult crankshaft bolts off without issue. Have used on Honda and GM vehicles so far. I've also used to remove sacraficial anode rod on hot water heater.....no need to hold the tank in place....it just zips it right out. I contemplated giving it 4 stars as it is very bulky.....it will not fit in tight places, but not many impacts will either.
customer_reviews.author: lrpasni

customer_reviews.title: GET'S THE JOB DONE
customer_reviews.text: A FINE TOOL... TAKES HARD JOBS AND MAKES UM' SIMPLE . I/R HAS ALWAYS BEEN QUALITY . c.w.lee tucson
customer_reviews.author: C.W.LEE

customer_reviews.title: Great product... Lots of power...
customer_reviews.text: i am not a mechanic but purchased this basically for rotating tires, minor car/truck work and and random things around the house... Probably much more power than i will ever need but so far it takes the lug nuts off my F350 with zero issues, Rotated all the tires on my dump trailer and again took the lugs off with ease... Makes it much easier and faster than lugging around an air compressor or dealing with a 100 ft hose... It is truly a great product and look forward to playing around with it more...
customer_reviews.author: Gilly7719

customer_reviews.title: Great impact wrench for the price
customer_reviews.text: I rotate the tires on approximately 10 vehicles a day and needed a dependable portable impact wrench. It was between this and a Milwaukee. I feel like I made the right choice. Very powerful and the batteries last me 4-5 days.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke da Cunha

customer_reviews.title: 7 Years and still running strong
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in 2013, it's currently 2020 and is still working great. Had some buddies who borrowed it for mobile maintenance when they were racing a rally and did the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Best gun there is
customer_reviews.text: This gun is amazing I use it every day on some the most rusted nasty looking bolts and I can not find any thing it wont bust loose most definitely one of the best and most durable guns I've seen so far. I use it on my face team with the mud bog truck and mud water and rain it never gives up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is so good that I'm thinking about getting the ratchet for those ...
customer_reviews.text: This things is POWER!!! If you do work on cars- hobby; shade tree; or professional (aka mechanic), or just want to know that you can take almost anything apart (and put it back together) then this is the tool for you. You cannot go wrong. This thing is so good that I'm thinking about getting the ratchet for those spaces that this won't fit. Get it. Yes, it's a little expensive, but compared to the shop rates, and the marked up cost of parts... it'll pay for itself after the first few jobs. It's AWESOME.
customer_reviews.author: SilkytheSamurai

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I love my purchase. This tool works great. I bought it used so it was a little warn. I've used it several times and have not had to switch batteries. My first use for this tool was to replace a wheel bearing hub assembly with a stubborn nut. It removed it with no problem. I definitely recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Hekela

customer_reviews.title: This gun is awesome. It will break axle nuts free without unstaking ...
customer_reviews.text: This gun is awesome. It will break axle nuts free without unstaking them. Along with every other nut/bolt that we've used it on.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to strong.
customer_reviews.text: Used on CV Shaft nuts and crankshaft bolts that are torqued and rusted. Took them right off. Well worth the money since air compressor might not be available went with the battery powered. Competes well with the air powered impacts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for changing tires. Very powerful & good quality. Arrived in time for Christmas. The kit is a great deal with 2 batteries
customer_reviews.author: Susabelle

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on other impact drills.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Bosch 1/2 impact drill that claimed ~500ft/lb of max torque but it's nothing compared to this thing. I had a stubborn brake retaining bolt and this took it off in seconds compared to the Bosch which failed to provide enough torque. If you are looking for an electric impact gun that will perform better than even most air impact tools don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: spacesuitdiver

customer_reviews.title: Ingersoll Rand Is THE Best!
customer_reviews.text: Auto mechanical applications. Removes lugs and bolts effortlessly. Recommend this product highly.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best tool I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best tool I've ever purchased. Charge holds for weeks if left alone. Used it to remove an entire drivetrain (including axle nuts) and it had enough charge and power to do it all... and I didn't charge it for another month afterwards. Worst part, it's on the heavy side. Second worst part, without the battery, it will not stand up on it's own.
customer_reviews.author: Driven

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the greatest tools I have purchased. You have to use this impact to believe the power it has. All of my guys go for this tool over our 1" IR air impact! It is light weight and small enough to get into tight places. I can not emphasize enough the torque this thing has, a masterpiece of cordless tools. Still going strong 1 year later, own two of them now.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Ramsay

customer_reviews.title: this tool has worked great for me for a month and only charged both ...
customer_reviews.text: I work in a shop, this tool has worked great for me for a month and only charged both battery's 3 times each, I have removed wheel lugs on a big truck which are tuff with a 3/4 air gun but had to change the battery after removing 10 nut's on one wheel but it did it. Great tool and would commend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D Smith

customer_reviews.title: Buy this, if you need a mobile impact
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased, it was a little skeptical at first but after reading the reviews I figured I would go for it, yes it's a little pricey but in my opinion if your on the fence just go for it and buy it. It busts lug nuts off with ease. I use it to take to the junkyard when I can't use air so if you go often and need an impact for larger stuff this thing is awesome
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Ziolkowski

customer_reviews.title: outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this impact wrench! I keep it in my truck to use with flats, and it works like a brute.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Hart

customer_reviews.title: Product reliability
customer_reviews.text: A month after use started giving me trigger issues, had to send to ingersoll for repair. Not saying it's a bad product from seller becasuse you really can't pin point the issue.
customer_reviews.author: najee

customer_reviews.title: Works great! My only complaint is how top heavy it ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! My only complaint is how top heavy it is (I think every electric impact is) and how easy to damage it is. But I bought some protective covers for it
customer_reviews.author: jdsk8er98

customer_reviews.title: Best tool ever
customer_reviews.text: By far now my favorite tool, was skeptical it could do as well as air. It's stronger them any air gun I've ever used able to break any bolt free it can get a bite on, careful or it will round heads down quick. Couldn't be happier with quality of tool and convience of portable power is worth every penny. Bought extra battery and cover and still feel I got a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Handles my Jeep & Explorer no problem. I've rotated tires on each vehicle a couple times so far on the first battery charge.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Baxter

customer_reviews.title: It has slightly better torque power than a Milwaukee counter tool
customer_reviews.text: I used this impact wrench to remove my rear tires. Several lug nuts had seized. This impact wrench took them off with ease. The battery surprisingly lasts a long time. I will never use manual labor to remove my tires again. This impact wrench is very convenient. It has slightly better torque power than a Milwaukee counter tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this impact
customer_reviews.text: I love this impact. My buddy has the snap on impact and loves his. But He's very impressed with the torque and power of the Ingersoll Rand W7150 gives. Holds a charge for months. I don't even use my air compressor anymore.
customer_reviews.author: James McGuire

customer_reviews.title: push the trigger very softly and smoothly, it's very powerful!
customer_reviews.text: it is immensely powerful tool. i have it only for two weeks but it was enough to broke 3 studs on my NIssan while unscrewing the threaded fasteners. one should push the trigger very very softly. it is a killer impact gun! :)
customer_reviews.author: nino a.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! The battery lasts quite a while and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! The battery lasts quite a while and it is much quieter than an air impact gun which is the main reason I got this. Plus it's completely portable.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur DIY mechanic, and since I have to work in the parking lot of my apartment building I have no access to air tools. The W7150 is just awesome - it rips axle nuts and huge suspension bolts off like they're not there, and the battery life is excellent. The only downside is the size and weight, which means that it won't get into spaces that an equally powerful air impact gun could. Overall, though, it's my favourite tool bar none, and although it's expensive, it's completely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: G. Randall

customer_reviews.title: Pleased I bought it - Reagan in Texas
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!!! This thing is AWESOME!!! Just used it to rotate the tires on the wife's Nissan Armada and it broke the lug nuts lose with ease! Tightened them up nice and snug also. Also used it on my 06 f250 and it broke them lose with ease! This thing is amazing. So much torque it's like it's not even having to work. Contemplated going w/ Dewalt or Busch to save a little on the price, would've sacrificed some torque though. So glad I paid a tad more. The extra battery is great and the case isn't a cheap piece of crap, it's solid. If you're on the fence, buy this one for sure. You will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Reagan Teel

customer_reviews.title: Great impact wrench.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very powerful. Takes of lug nuts easily. Had a Dewalt before. So much better and smoother. I just got it so, hopefully, I don't have issues in the future.
customer_reviews.author: amukak

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I haven't really used it that much but the few times that I did, no issues and great breaking power on lugs. Cant go wrong with Ingersoll Rand.
customer_reviews.author: Scuderia Ferrari

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on other torque guns this one will do any job.
customer_reviews.author: erika

customer_reviews.title: Nice portable impact
customer_reviews.text: Using this product in heavy equipment repair.. Works as good as air for a 1/2 inch drive... Should have bought a back up battery. . Good for about 8 hrs steady use
customer_reviews.author: Eric M. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband & he absolutely loves it. Much more powerful than he expected.
customer_reviews.author: Liz1945

customer_reviews.title: Straight Forward... It does what it supposed to and well.
customer_reviews.text: If you like products that does what it says, does it well, and does it with quality. Buy this, forget the price and enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Curry

customer_reviews.title: I haven't had the need to remove anything crazy like big rig wheel nuts but I was able to ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the pneumatic impact since I got this. Its so convenient and it does everything I need without wanting more power. I haven't had the need to remove anything crazy like big rig wheel nuts but I was able to knock off some suspension bolts torqued to 159ft lbs at 25% battery power with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S.

customer_reviews.title: Strong and powerful
customer_reviews.text: im by no means a professional mechanic. i compared this to the snap-on one, which is decently more expensive with less performance numbers on paper. this will get the every day person by with more than enough and then some. it's a shame it's not made in the USA, however.
customer_reviews.author: BV

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Excellent power. Have to be careful as this is not adjustable power.
customer_reviews.author: OreGun Farm Boy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good impact gun.Has power .The battery charge led meter helpfull, so you know when to charge battery again.
customer_reviews.author: Big Derek

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable power!
customer_reviews.text: It will drive 1.5 inch sockets with ease. I did maintenance on a semi wheel, and it broke them loose with ease!! Love it! Buy the red boot too when you get the tool. Well worth the money. This impact is used regularly on a service truck.
customer_reviews.author: john williamson

customer_reviews.title: favorite tool hands down!!
customer_reviews.text: Like other i was skeptical about this cordless tool having enough power, well, i took apart a car pretty much. old rusted big nuts and bolts!! amazed me, doesn't look and doesn't feel that powerful, but it is! changing wheels is a piece of cake now! so glad i went with it. quality seems up there. hopefully it last!
customer_reviews.author: Fredy Duarte

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Impact
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my son who works at a tire store. He uses it daily at work and brings it home for weekend projects. This is one of my best tool purchases! I would highly recommend this impact.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: Awesome just awesome.
customer_reviews.text: All the power you could ever need. We tested it on the toughest bolts we could find on a pick up truck. It broke loose ubolt nuts and leaf spring bolts with little effort plus several others we tried. Bo more using gas powered air compressors and air tools!
customer_reviews.author: Andy K.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, high quality, great price!
customer_reviews.text: What a powerful impact gun! When I got this straight out of the box the battery had about a half charge to it and when you squeeze the trigger hang on. You can tell there is a lot of torque in this tool. I look forward to many years of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: J. amell

customer_reviews.title: Better valve then snap on
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I’m a mechanic and use snap on tool and this is just as powerful and $300 less then snap on version. Goes with me any time pulling a trailer. Makes a tire change on the side of the road quick and painless.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Trigger stop fails
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one in under a year. My first one was stolen so I ordered another, my only complaint is that both guns the trigger stop stoped working. Very annoying to have to wait for it to stop.
customer_reviews.author: Epi

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: 2nd one purchased. Our mechanic liked the first one so much, we gave it to him. This to replace 1st one haven't used it yet. If it works as well as the first, great tool!
customer_reviews.author: C Foor

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Researched other brands like D Walt Milwaukee this product works great in an industrial setting.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Purtle

customer_reviews.title: misrepresented contents
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 2 battery kit, pictures and description clearly stated two batteries. label on case said 2 batteries. Only had 1 battery inside.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Willhoit

customer_reviews.title: Nice, quality tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Very solid and obviously well made. It's brand new, so it's impossible to know how long it will last, but so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cool

customer_reviews.title: best you can get.
customer_reviews.text: Top notch. This is the best you can buy. I saw a poster was concerned about the sturdyness of it. We accidentally left ours in the way of an 85,000lb machine and it got tracked over. The only damage was a few grouser marks from the tracks. Has been working flawless for 1 year now. If you couple it to any of the competitions cordless guns, it will shell out the competitors gun. One thing I would like to note, they do require periodical maintenance. You have to apply a THIN coating of grease to the orbit gears. Not at all a big deal. We also have snapon and dewalt cordless impacts. They are pathetic.
customer_reviews.author: sd-dirt

customer_reviews.title: a lot of power for it's size
customer_reviews.text: has a lot of power for it's size, so far all i've pulled off was some lug nuts on a old john deere tractor, that have not been pulled off in years, i was just hoping it would not snap them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ingersoll Rand W7150 1/2-Inch High-Torque Impactool
customer_reviews.text: i used this tool a little over a year and it started smoking and had rpm loss ....i stopped using it and am looking to get it repaired, That is not like any other IR tool I have,,,???????
customer_reviews.author: Shane Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: I can't say enough good things about this impact gun
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this impact gun. I don't even use my matco air gun anymore. This thing has done every wheel, steering rack, exhaust bolt, crank bolt, and rusted exhaust bolt I've thrown at it. It allows very precise trigger control and the batteries charge SUPER quickly! They last me a few days per battery also. This is the gun that will do everything. Brushless makes a HUGE difference.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Constantine

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this to anyone who uses a pneumatic impact
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one because I am so please with the first one that I bought. I have one at work and now one for at home. I would recommend this to anyone who uses a pneumatic impact. It is better.
customer_reviews.author: Plummer Paige

customer_reviews.title: Good but ultimately broke.
customer_reviews.text: We use this impact daily in our shop. As of 1 year from the purchase date, the impact is broken. Still will move in forward but reverse is inoperable. Its a strong impact with a great battery life, when it isn't broken.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Harvey

customer_reviews.title: The best!!
customer_reviews.text: You just can’t go wrong with Ingersoll Rand. This has the power of the air ones. Excellent battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Very powerfull impact gun
customer_reviews.text: I work on a auto repair facility, After use it for more than a month this gun its very powerfull I had no problem taken out heavy bolts, tires, front end parts, battery charge prety fast, the only thing its heavy and when u really want to heavy tork vibrates and shakes so you need to hold firmly but over all I love it
customer_reviews.author: prcsmobile

customer_reviews.title: Best tool no more busted knuckles!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a cordless impact for a long time. This is one of the best tools I have now!!
customer_reviews.author: Frequent buyer

customer_reviews.title: Makes my 18volt snap on look like a 3/8 impact
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this impact so far, it is a BEAST! Makes my 18volt snap on look like a 3/8 impact. It will drive a 5" lag bolt with ease, haven't used it on auto's yet but I know it will break bolts.......literally!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: And beast of an impact wrench
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly good product. Removes stuck bolts and nuts with ease and quickness. Was trying an air impact wrench and applying heat to remove an axle nut for several days. Got this, charged it and used it. Took less than. A couple seconds to remove the nut. The torque is amazing. Well worth the cost. Best impact wrench I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ferg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great value and performance. Much more then I expected so far.
customer_reviews.author: Baroque

customer_reviews.title: Great gun. Dont wear it out doing tires like ...
customer_reviews.text: Great gun. Dont wear it out doing tires like i did. Switch module is acting up and cuts out in reverse. Too many tires..
customer_reviews.author: Kris Lizana

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Great tool at a great price! Prime day is the perfect time to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R Jungwirth

customer_reviews.title: Great impact !
customer_reviews.text: Awsome product , I totally reccomend this , yes, it is not as powerful as a air powered impact , but very close! Great !
customer_reviews.author: grant Jordan.

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in timely fashion, securely packaged, all expected parts of kit present! Charged and functioned with excellent power and portability as designed. Could have designed directional switch with more thought or detent strength, easily to accidentally hit directional switch while holding in hand for use. But very impressive power for the job and size of tool!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: This machine is incredible, lots of power to work ...
customer_reviews.text: This machine is incredible, lots of power to work on my big rig, will no be needing my air compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Fili

customer_reviews.title: Very  dependable
customer_reviews.text: I work in a professional shop and this gun has held its weight and then some
customer_reviews.author: Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Better than snap on
customer_reviews.text: No bolt or nut to tough!!! Much better than pneumatic power.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES F.

product_meta.title: Ingersoll Rand W7150-K1 ½” Hi-Torque Impact One Battery Kit
product_meta.description: Style:Charger, (1) 3 Ah BatteryConvenience of Cordless. Power of Air. The W7150 1/2-Inch 20V High-Torque Impactool is the only cordless impact wrench that can perform pound-for-pound with our best-in-class 2135TiMAX, 1/2-Inch air Impactool, the W7150 cordless tool will make quick work of tough jobs that professional technicians do every day. Do the Job. Do it Fast. Do it Every Time.
feature_bullets: Power: 780 ft-lbs of maximum reverse torque and 1100 ft-lb of nut-busting torque from cordless impact wrench that weighs only 6.8 lbs
Durability: Steel-lined aluminum hammer case designed to be strong and light-weight for maximum protection of the internal components
Comfort: Patent-pending soft touch over-molded grip minimizes vibration, reduces fatigue and enhances user comfort during extended use
W7150-K1 Standard Anvil One Battery Kit: Includes W7150 Impactool, IQV20 Charger, 20V li-ion 3.0 Ah batteries, Blow–molded case

specifications.Warranty Description: Year 1: 1 year free replacement of Tools, Chargers, and BatteriesYear 2: 2 year free replacement of bateries =>2.4 Ahr or greater ratingYear 3: 3 year free repair or replacement for defects in material/workmanship for Tools & Chargers
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars655 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
